sec.p: Aerial part (stems and leaves) of R. officinalis was harvested during April 2015, in the region of El-Euchre, in the Department of Bordj Bou Arreridj, located in Northeastern Algeria. The harvested plants were dried in the shade for 10 days before extraction.

Extraction of the essential oil was carried out by hydrodistillation process using a Clevenger’s type apparatus (Clevenger, 1928). Distillations were carried out by boiling aerial plant parts for 3 h, and the essential oil was kept in air-tight sealed vials and stored at 4°C until further use.
